fr.epita.sp18.service

Class IdentityService

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.epita.sp18.service.IdentityService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseService

    @Service
public class IdentityService
extends java.lang.Object
implements BaseService
    IdentityService is a layer between the API controller and IdentityDAO service. It convert API's request to DAO's method parameter and translate DAO's reply into API's response format. The service also translate DAO's errors into user's readable text messages.

    This service return an ApiReponse object with:

    - ApiReponse.model = DAO's result.

    - ApiResponse.hasError = true when any Exceptional error occurred.

    - ApiResponse.errorMessage = error explanation if any

    Author:
    Philip

    • Constructor Detail

      • IdentityService

        public IdentityService(org.springframework.security.crypto.bcrypt.BCryptPasswordEncoder bCryptPasswordEncoder)
        Construct the IdentityService with an BCryptPasswordEncoder to hash identity's raw password receiving from controller
        Parameters:
        bCryptPasswordEncoder - The encoder for raw password

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> get(java.lang.Long uid)
        Query identity by primary key. Example when calling it from the controller: 
         @GetMapping(value = "/{uid}")
 public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> get(@PathVariable("uid") Long uid)
 {
     return service.get(uid);
 }
        Parameters:
        uid - Primary key of the expected identity
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.model = found identity or null when not found.

      • search

        public ApiResponse<java.util.List<IdentityResponse>> search(java.lang.String filter,
                                                            java.lang.String sort)
        Search for identities that name or email contain keyword
        Parameters:
        filter - Searching keyword in String format
        sort - Sort order String format. Controller does not use this parameter at the moment
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.model = List<Identity> when found or null when not found

      • findByEmail

        public Identity findByEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Find the identity by its email address. Email is an unique index of Identity entity
        Parameters:
        email - Email address of the expected identity
        Returns:
        Identity object of the expected identity or null when not found

      • delete

        public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> delete(java.lang.Long uid)
        Delete the identity base on its primary key
        Parameters:
        uid - Primary key of the to-be-deleted identity. Integer 64 bits
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.hasError = false when deleting successfully. Otherwise, the ApiResponse.errorMessage will have the explanation for error

      • create

        public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> create(IdentityRequest request)
        Insert a new identity into the database. A new identity primary key will be generated regardless existing uid value of identity object in the parameter
        Parameters:
        request - An IdentityRequest object, carries identity's value to be inserted
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.model = newly inserted identity (without password property) when inserting successfully. Otherwise, the ApiResponse.errorMessage will have the explanation for error and ApiResponse.hasError = true

      • update

        public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> update(IdentityRequest request)
        Update current identity in the database with new value from the parameter, including identity's password
        Parameters:
        request - An IdentityRequest object, carries identity's value to be updated
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.model = newly updated identity (without password property) when inserting successfully. Otherwise, the ApiResponse.errorMessage will have the explanation for error and ApiResponse.hasError = true

      • patch

        public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> patch(IdentityRequest request)
        Update current identity in the database with new value from the parameter, excluding identity's password. Identity's password will remain intact.
        Parameters:
        request - An IdentityRequest object, carries identity's value to be updated. IdentityRequest.password will be ignored
        Returns:
        ApiResponse object that has ApiResponse.model = newly updated identity (without password property) when inserting successfully. Otherwise, the ApiResponse.errorMessage will have the explanation for error and ApiResponse.hasError = true
